title_sort: walter whitman reynolds to walt whitman, [?]
title: Walter Whitman Reynolds to Walt Whitman, [?]
text: New YorkNovMy Dear friend WalterI received your letter of the 29th and was very glad to here[hear] from you I am very sorry to keep you waiting so long for my answer. we have just got done taking account of stock I have ben[been] very busy for the last too[two] weeks. I am working in the same place. I am very tired when I get home at night my feet are very sore from the nails sticking up on the heels of my shoes I wish you a Merry Christmas I was very glad to get your Picture I think it looks very much like you I send you mine in return I have received the title of Unkle[Uncle] my sister Josephine has a little Boy he is one week old his name is John K. Crum he weigh ten pounds I am going to get my wages raised after the Holidays father has just received Employment In the pipe yard foot of 24th of East River mother & father send there[their] Regards this is all at presentWith Love I remain your Affectionate friendWalter Whitman R. Walter Whitman Reynolds to Walt Whitman, [?]
